content.description: Walk toward the spire and look for the line of bolts (hard to miss). Connect the dots and enjoy a couple of big rest ledges along the way. Don't forget to look left after making the last clip! A feeling of exposure here and the view from the top makes the climb even better.
content.protection: 4 quickdraws. A tiny nut may be desired before the 4th bolt.
content.location: Follow the thin trail on the right of Cracked Wall. Look for the spire on your left.

content.description: A lot of loose rock exists on this climb. Follow the arête on the right after clipping the first bolt. Don't even think about touching the loose, toothlike roof feature that is left of the last bolt. The only purpose of this route would be to extend your climb above Cracked Wall on your way to Owl's Perch. Other than that, the climb isn't worth much on its own.
content.protection: 5 quickdraws. Huge, flat, walkable area at the top. Walk off.
content.location: Located right of the Mouse Maze and Lama anchors at the top of Cracked Wall.

content.description: Found on the back side of Owl's perch, this climb is located furthest to the left. Two bolts protect the bottom 5.10 moves. After the 2nd bolt your on your own to the anchors. Easy 5.6 Climbing. It is suggested that there is some small pro to protect the top, but either I didn't see the good spots or they are really bad. Either way defiantly gets an R rating if you run out the 30 feet after the 2nd bolt.
content.location: Back Side of Owl's Perch. Furthest bolts to the left as you face the wall.

content.description: "Starts right of 'K-B Trip.' Look for bolt 1 just below the large flake. Rap back to the base or move out right from the top and scramble to the base of “Private Pepper” (5.7) on Jam Crack Wall." - John Knight, Bishop Peak eGuide 2010
content.protection: 5 bolts + small gear if you want to protect the easy terrain at the top
content.location:
Right most bolt line on Hallucinogen Wall, just left of large dirty flakes. Directly behind Owl's Perch.

Usually done as part of the

"2 Hour 2 Tecate" Link-up

. The hike between Hallucinogen Wall and

Jam Crack Wall

is the worst part of the Bishop Peak Link-up requiring a traverse through dense brush, and steep, loose vegetation.
